Awesome. Brilliant noise cancellation. Comfortable. Only annoyance is the bright lights on the side and you can't turn off Google assistant, so accidentally touching the wrong place causes it to bark at you that it's not setup.

Apr√®s une bonne quinzaine de jours d'utilisation, je dirais que ce casque est plut√¥t confortable (m√™me si parfois il me fait un peu mal avec mes lunettes mais c'est tout de m√™me supportable) Au niveau du son, le son est puissant et quasiment parfait (en effet j'aurai aim√© entendre un petit peu moins les aigus sur certaines musiques mais j'ai r√©gl√© le probl√®me en ajoutant une application √©qualiseur qui permet √©galement de r√©gler les basses si l'on veut les renforcer, sinon il n'y a pas de latence perceptible entre le son et l'image, maintenant au niveau de l'autonomie : elle est tout simplement excellente ; premi√®re recharge d'une dur√©e de deux heures au bout de quinze jours avec une utilisation moyenne d'une heure par jour environ. Mon seul vrai souci, c'est que ce casque JBL E55BT ne fonctionne pas en bluetooth avec la Playsation 4 (Pro) comme de nombreux autres casques apparemment... grrr SONY En parlant du d√©sign ; je le trouve magnifique mais c'est mon avis personnel Des personnes parlaient dans certains commentaires de bruits de grincement de plastique, pour ma part je n'ai rien entendu de tel Pour conclure : Je ne regrette en rien mon achat, quand √† mon raccordement bluetooth pour ma PS4, je viens de commander un √©metteur-r√©cepteur bluetooth "LL" (d'une marque commen√ßant par Z) qui se branche sur la prise casque d'une t√©l√© ou autre... Vous pouvez acheter ce casque les yeux ferm√©s.

Son net, pure, bonne basse, m√©dium et aigus tres efficaces. Pas boomy comme beaucoup d'autres de nos jours. A recommander pour ceux qui veulent √©couter de la belle musique. Pas de noise cancelling mais loverear couvre bien les bruits ext√©rieurs. Largeur des oreillettes juste bien pour accueillir mes oreilles sans probl√®me. Excellent bluetooth. Casque id√©al aussi pour les moments en transports publics car il tient bien s√ªr la t√™te sans serrer. 5 etoiles car aucun d√©faut. Vraiment content de ce casque.

A ce prix je ne m'attendais pas √† √ßa.... En premier lieu la qualit√© du produit en plastique certes mais bien finis et bien r√©fl√©chis, ce qui me plait le plus c'est le confort les coussinets sont vraiment parfait je pense qu'ils vont dur√© dans le temps et confortable, l'appairage se fait simplement, le son n'est pas extraordinaire on va √™tre franc donc les audiophiles passer votre chemin √ßa reste tout √† fait correct pour moi. Je l'utilise tout les jours pour aller au boulot et un peu √† la maison je ne le recharge que deux fois dans la semaine, parfois seulement une fois donc c'est vraiment bien, je ne suis pas fan des produits jbl √† la base mais j'avais vue des tests et je me suis laisser tenter et bien j'ai eus raison je conseille ce casque pour ceux qui recherchent quelque chose de simple plut√¥t solide et √† usage quotidien.

Bon casque. Bon son. Se connecte rapidement en Bluetooth √† mon t√©l√©phone. Tient environ 20h avant d'√™tre recharg√©. Meilleur en Bluetooth qu'en filliaire. Pour les appels, il vaut mieux utiliser le fil si vous appelez dans un endroit bruyant. Boutons de contr√¥les pour augmenter/baisser le son et pour faire play/pause. Pas de boutons pour changer de morceaux. Pas de syst√®me actif de r√©duction du bruit. Mais √©tant un casque circum-aural (qui entoure bien l'oreille) cela permet une bonne r√©duction du bruit. Confortable. Ne sert pas la t√™te.

Bon produit re√ßu dans les temps et en tr√®s bon √©tat. Ce casque sans fil de la marque JBL fait le boulot de fa√ßon honorable. Le son est tr√®s clair et la technologie de r√©duction de bruit est tr√®s appr√©ciable, surtout quand on se balade dans la rue car elle r√©duit les bruits ambiants mais elle ne vous emp√™che d'entendre √† cot√© de vous quelqu'un qui vous parle sans crier. Il est beau et confortable √† porter. La liaison bluetooth fonctionne bien, j'ai pu l'appairer avec plusieurs appareils diff√©rents sans probl√®me. L'autonomie est tr√®s appr√©ciable. Pour donner une id√©e, je l'utilise tous les jours matin et soir dans les transports pour des trajets d'environ 45 minutes et je le recharge √† peu pr√®s tous les 10 jours sans qu'il soit √† plat. Le seul b√©mol serait ce petit gr√©sillement que l'on entend pendant les silences quand on regarde un film mais ce n'est pas son utilit√© premi√®re. Sinon, je suis tr√®s content de ce casque et le prix √©tait int√©ressant au moment o√π je l'ai achet√©.

- Qualit√© du son : signature JBL +++ (son produit par de puissants hauts parleurs fabriqu√©s par Harman Kardon √† l'origine de la sonorit√© unique des enceintes install√©es dans les Mercedes Benz) ; - Autonomie batterie : 20 h (apr√®s 2 heures de charge uniquement) ; - Commutation ais√©e entre les appareils (fonctionne aussi bien avec un smartphone Android - Samsung par exemple - qu'avec un Iphone) ; - Arceau textile tr√®s confortable (m√™me au bout de 2 heures d'utilisation) ; - Casque circum-aural (ou circum auriculaire) ce qui signifie que le coussinet du casque enveloppe enti√®rement votre oreille (c'est plus confortable qu'un casque supra auriculaire qui compresse l'oreille). Vous constaterez imm√©diatement que ce casque r√©duit consid√©rablement les bruits ext√©rieurs en permet une √©coute plus nette, plus fluide ; - Fonctionne en mode sans fil (bluetooth) ou en mode c√¢bl√© compatible avec la plupart des t√©l√©phones intelligents (mode cabl√© v√©rifi√© sur mon Samsung mais je pr√©f√®re le mode sans fil)

J'ai le casque JBL depuis un mois et j'en suis tr√®s satisfaite ! Il semble solide, et fait tr√®s bien le boulot au niveau son et connectivit√©. J'avais lu beaucoup d'avis et je ne suis pas d√©√ßue. L'autonomie est top. Seul point a revoir pour moi, la sacoche de rangement serait un plus, et egalement si vous avez quelques euros en plus pour votre budget, j'en prendrai un avec reducteur de bruit, la musique s'entends quand meme pas mal si on est dans un endroit assez silencieux.. mais convient tres bien pour une utilisation dans les transports en commun ou en ville par exemple. En bref, pour le prix je recommande !

Ich finde den E55BT ziemlich gut. F√ºr um die 100 ‚Ç¨ bekommt man einen Kopfh√∂rer, der einen (f√ºr meine Ohren) sehr ausgewogenen, guten Sound bietet. Gute Tiefen und keine √ºbertriebenen Mitten oder H√∂hen. Der Akku h√§lt lange durch (gef√ºhlte 5-7 Stunden). Ich lade den K√∂pfh√∂rer, bei eher unregelm√§√üiger Nutzung, alle paar Wochen auf. Der E55BT verbindet sich schnell und problemlos mit iPad oder iPhone. Sollte der Akku leer sein, man aber trotzdem Musik h√∂ren wollen, liegt ein Audiokabel bei. Beim Audiokabel f√§llt auf, dass es durch eine gewebeverst√§rkte Au√üenummantelung sehr strapazierf√§hig ist. Sehr gut! Geladen wird der (nicht wechselbare) Akku √ºber ein beiliegendes USB-Kabel. Beim Laden wird der Bluetooth-Empfang abgeschaltet. Das finde ich nicht so toll, aber auch nicht tragisch. Meine Anwendung ist eher Laden ODER Musik h√∂ren. Wer sich einen Over-Ear-Kopfh√∂rer kauft sollte wissen, dass man zwar wenig Umgebungsger√§usche h√∂rt, aber daf√ºr warme Ohren bekommt. Im Sommer (am Strand) w√ºrde ich den JBL nicht lange tragen wollen. Wer also in dieser Beziehung empfindlich ist, der sollte sich f√ºr On-Ear- oder In-Ear-Kopfh√∂rer entscheiden. Das ist aber keine Eigenschaft des E55BT, sondern prinzipbedingt bei Over-Ear-Kopfh√∂rern. Das Gewicht. Dass ein drahtloser Kopfh√∂rer auf Grund seines Akkus nicht zu den Fliegengewichten geh√∂rt, sollte jedem klar sein. Nach meinem Empfinden liegt der JBL hier im mittleren Bereich. Fazit: + guter Sound + einfache Verbindung mit iOS-Ger√§ten + lange Laufzeit + gutes Audiokabel + gute Verarbeitung - kein Bluetooth beim Laden - Bedienteil an der hinteren rechten Ohrmuschel nur mit √úbung sicher zu bedienen Ich w√ºrde ihn wieder kaufen.

Pros: 1. Fit: Comfort fit with ears completely enclosed inside the earphone. Doesn't press your ears hard. But your ears might feel sweaty after 30 mins of usage 2. Noise cancellation: Perfect fit with the ears ensures zero noise from surrounding 3. Battery: If you are a moderate user (1-2 hrs a day), battery will last for a week. 4. Sound: Even at low volumes, you can hear little shrills of the song 5. Design: Looks premium and contemporary with knitted threads running across earphone covering the plastic. Surprised to notice that wires were also designed that way. Cons: 1. Cover: Though one can fold the earphones, pouch is not available to keep the earphones unlike Bose's headsets 2. Size: Looks bulky as it encloses ears completely Bottomline: Good buy in 6k range

Im Mai habe ich mir die roten JBL Kopfh√∂rer gekauft, doch im August musste ich sie leider schon reklamieren. Eigentlich war ich mit dem Sound und der Akkulaufzeit der Kopfh√∂rer sehr zufrieden. Doch als es diesen Sommer sehr hei√ü wurde, ist die Beschichtung der Ohrmuschelpolsterung schmierig und klebrig geworden und hat abgef√§rbt. Sehr schade, ich hoffe das es nur ein Serienfehler ist und das Problem bald behoben wird.

I bought these through Amazon Warehouse as a cheap (but good) stop-gap while I save up to replace my much more expensive Bose headphones that died. Honestly though, besides the lack of active noise cancelling, these headphones have grown on me to the point where I'm not in such a rush to get a more premium headset. So there's a bunch of reviews that already vouch for the sound quality. JBL are known for having a bassy sound signature, similar to Beats, but this one is different. It's more smooth and warm with very clean detail and a sense of space and separation of instruments. Wired and wireless, these sound great, so you won't be disappointed. For me, the real benefits come from some small touches that make a huge difference. My favourite is the way this powers on and off. There is a little notch you just flick once. This is SO much better than most Bluetooth headphones that need you to hold the power button for 3-5 seconds, which is quickly gets annoying. Good job, JBL. I also love the dual connect ability. I have the headphones paired with my phone and iPad. The cool thing about this is I can switch between devices and sound will play between either device without having to do anything to the headphones or Bluetooth settings. For me, this was the killer feature that finally made me prefer wireless over wired. Speaking of wired, these can be connected by any generic 2.5mm headphone jack. Huge kudos to JBL for not getting unnecessarily proprietary with their headphone jack (I'm looking at you, AKG and Sennheiser...). I also like that the headphones twist downwards when you wear them around your neck. This keeps them out of the way, despite the big cups. This one is extremely subjective... the headphones are extremely comfortable. I wear glasses and have relatively small ears. Because of that, my ears very neatly fit inside the cups and the padding if soft enough to gently hug my head without pressing on my glasses. Because of that, I can wear them all day without getting uncomfortable. In fact, during this winter season, I've used them as ear mittens. they do a good job of keeping the cold from my ears. Apart from the lack of active noise cancellation, the only criticism I have for them is they do creak, especially if you have a heavy walk or move around a lot. I only notice this when I'm rushing to get somewhere, otherwise I rarely hear it. Considering how many plus points there are to these headphones, the slight creaking is really not a big deal to me... but your mileage may vary. I can see that massively bothering some people. That being said, I really recommend you give these a try. They are easily the best headphones I've ever owned under ¬£50.

JBL E55BT. Me gusta la musica, mucho, pero carezco de la agudeza auditiva de otros, que hablan de graves, agudos y armonicos con total soltura. Desde luego a mi me suenan cojonudos. Quiz√°s es que nunca hab√≠a tenido unos auriculares tan buenos (y caros) pero estoy muy satisfecho. Son muy comodos y, pese a que carecen de cancelaci√≥n activa de ruido, aislan muy bien. Tal vez sea cierto que al ser tan cerrados den calor en verando, y mas viviendo en Sevilla. Ya veremos. Respecto a la bater√≠a me ha durado en torno a 18h escuchando musica a volumen medio. Por √∫ltimo el apartado estetico me encanta, pero eso ya es algo muy personal. Muy recomendables. He leido en otras rese√±as que las almohadillas se acaban rompiendo. He visto que las venden por 8‚Ç¨ y es un coste que estoy dispuesto a aceptar.

Prodotto arrivato nei tempi indicati. Inzio dicendo che prendo queste cuffie dopo averne provate altre su questa linea di prezzo (sennheiser hd4.40, shure 840) Queste jbl sono esteticamente pi√π belle delle HD 4.40. ed io le trovo anche comode l'orecchio viene coperto completamente, nel mio caso. L'archetto √® rivestito in tessuto, non √® mai fastidioso. Evito di parlare delle caratteristiche e delle funzioni in quanto hanno gi√† scritto in altre recensioni, (collegamento rapido, tasti non comodissimi ma accettabili...) SUONO Vorrei parlare piuttosto del suono di queste jbl e55bt, il suono stupisce (anche senza rodaggio completato) √® incredibile che (112‚Ç¨, pagate 99 in offerta) jbl sia riuscita a creare una cuffia Bluetooth con driver da 50mm e allo stasso tempo il dac per la conversione del segnale Bluetooth accettabile. Il suono restituito √® gradevole, il sound stage √® pi√π che accettabile considerando le alternative su questa fascia (con Bluetooth ovviamente). Certo che paragonate con cuffie della stessa fascia ma senza Bluetooth il discorso cambia, le shure 840 suonano senza dubbio meglio ma d'altronde le shure 840 non hanno il Bluetooth e sono molto ingombranti quindi meno comode per la mobilit√†. Gli alti sono presenti e abbastanza estesi, cristallini mai fastidiosi. I bassi sono profondi, forse la decadenza del basso √® un po' lentuccia ma niente di gravissimo su questa fascia di prezzo. I bassi hanno qualche db in pi√π rispetto ai medi, ma √® una scelta logica considerando le "rivali" di queste cuffie. Nella totalit√† posso dire che nei brani dove ci sono pochi bassi avremo un ascolto corretto e mai artefatto, dove invece i bassi sono molto presenti li sentiremo molto bene. I medi forse mancano un pochino di v√®rv ma la chitarra √® ben udibile e chiara a mio parare con un tocco in rialzo sui 250hz e 500hz si ottiene un risultato davvero inaspettato!! VOLUME E QUALCHE TEST Il volume massimo √® fin troppo alto, non distorce mai n√© con file mp3 n√© con file senza compressione (flac). Sicuramente se le usate con Android e volete divertirvi a tirare fuori qualcosa in pi√π da queste jbl, munitevi di power-amp ed equalizzate un minimo in ribasso i bassi e in rialto i medi e ne sarete soddisfatti. Quello che colpisce √® il livello di dettaglio che avremo con qualche piccolo ritocco. Ma anche senza il risultato √® soddisfacente. Provate anche in aux con scheda audio dedicata,non ci sono grandi differenze, avendo una bassa impedenza, anche senza amplificazioni del segnale si possono ascoltare in mobilit√†. Certo √® che un segnale amplificato dar√† sempre miglioramenti (timbrica migliore ad esempio). Isolamento buono, non sono completamente insonorizzate a volumi alti alti ma √® pi√π che normale. I rumori esterni pi√π fastidiosi non li sentiremo anche usandole a bassi volumi. Le HD4. 40 non riescono a stare dietro a queste jbl che suonano meglio su tutti gli aspetti. Stesso vale per altri prodotti su questa fascia ma di altre marche come Sony ad esempio. Un acquisto consigliato, se trovate offerte diventa praticamente un acquisto obbligato se volete Bluetooth ma non volete spendere troppo. PS. Aggiorner√≤ la recensione dopo che avr√≤ completato il rodaggio e avr√≤ avuto modo di provare in mobilit√†.

Good sound quality, the bass are great, the battery life time is quite satisfactory too, but, the construction is not so good, due to a simple headphone drop, I now have problems with the sound on the left side... For the price, maybe you can find others with better quality... Die kopfh√∂rer habe ich im Angebot f√ºr 88‚Ç¨ gekauft, Zuvor habe ich Razer Adaro Stereo benutzt, welche leider nach 3 Jahren kaputt gingen. Dieser Kopfh√∂rer ist jedoch kein w√ºrdiger Nachvolger. Die Verarbeitung ist ok, aber das Material macht einen sehr billigen Eindruck, und er besteht fast nur aus Plastik an den Muscheln. Der kopfh√∂rer klappert und sitzt auch nicht 100% fest.Das leder ist nicht hochwertig und pellt sich langsam nach ca.3-4 monaten ab au√üerdem ist es nicht sonderlich bequem. Besonders bei hitze( nicht unnormal im Sommer) schmilzt der bezug und kann mit den Haaren verkleben. Danach ist die haftbeschichtung verzogen und es sieht weder sch√∂n aus, noch ist es sch√∂n Haare und Kopfh√∂rer zu trennen Sie sch√ºtzen ausenstehende nicht vor der eigenen Musik , sind demnach durchl√§ssig! Der sound ist auch f√ºr den doppelten preis der adaro nicht atembersubend geschweigeden besser. Schlecht ist er nicht aber in meinen augen keinesfalls 88-120‚Ç¨ Wert. Das Bluetooth ist jedoch excellent und h√§lt eine starke Verbindung such √ºber ein Stockwerk hinweg. Der akku h√§lt lange da gibt es keine probleme. Auch von der Lautst√§rke sind sie toll und msn ksnn voll aufdrehen( nur zuhause sonst st√∂rt es andere). Sollte dies ein einzelfall sein, ist der Kopfh√∂rer nicht schlecht und eine kaufempfehlung. Sollten jedoch alle klappern und kleben ist das risiko diesen Kopfhlrer zu kaufen sehr hoch, und es kann gut passieren dass sie entt√§uscht werden. F√ºr mich waren diese 88‚Ç¨ eine verschwendung da ich nicht zufrieden damit bin. Keine Kaufempfehlung!

I have been using this headphone for already 1 Year. The sound quality does do justice to the price of this item. I mean, all is as expected. Nothing bad, and nothing that exceeds my expectation. I like the simple design. The buttons are well placed too (unless you have big fingers), and I can say it is quite durable. What I like most about this item is its exceptional battery life. With the average of 2-hour listening time a day, I can go for weeks without charging!! The Bluetooth in this device works really well too. I have no problem connecting it to my iphone. The downside of this item is the comfort. The band is quite tight for an above-average head size. I think this is more suitable for those with smaller head size. And, It is not the heaviest, but the weight is not in the lightweight category either. All in all, if you 1) hate to charge your headphones regularly, 2) need a decent sound 3) want a seamless Bluetooth connectivity, with a rather small head, this is PERFECT for you.

I used this for about 3 months until the left side malfunction. I bear with it for another 2 months by constantly trying to make it work each time I turn on the headphones. Sometimes it does, but most of the time not. It became so annoying that I have decided to leave this review.

I done a little bit of research before buying the jbl e55bt. I was on a budget and found the e55bt to be a great contender in its class. The build is pretty decent and they look decently built. These headphones are loud and when I say loud I mean loud enough to not cause ear damage in the future. I've never gone above 3 quarters volume. They have noise cancellation but not active noise cancellation. Which means it still cuts out noise but a headset with NC would probably do a better job. On the train these were good, I could hear well without the interference of train noise. I'm yet to test them on a plane to see how well they cancel Noise. Overall I would say I like these headphones because they give a flat sound. No enhancements or boosts. Simply how any track was mastered and finished is how the e55bt will display the sound. Comfort - I've not really worn them for a long time so I can't really comment on that factor. Great for their price. Any one who wants more to offer than the e55bt will know exactly what they want. Don't be expecting to be blown away by the sound quality. These are standard and good for every day use.

I had some more expensive Beats Studio Wireless headphones stolen from my desk at work a while ago now. I finally got around to replacing them but didn't want to spend a huge amount of money all over again so I went for the JBL E55BTs. They are great - I have no complaints. The sound quality is spot on, the fit is comfortable and the ability to connect via bluetooth to more than one device at a time is brilliant. The build quality is reasonable. The plastic used feels a little lightweight and cheap but nothing too bad. The only one very minor gripe I have is in relation to the controls on the right ear cup. I personally find it hard to distinguish the forward, stop and backward buttons by touch. The design just doesn't make it easy and skipping forward vs increasing volume can be a pain - you have to hold the forward button down for some time before it recognises what you are wanting it to do - i.e. skip a track. Those are minor gripes, for sure. Overall, I really have no regrets and no issue recommending these headphones to anyone (unless you want noise cancellation, in which case, these won't do the job - personally, I don't like noise cancellation).

Ich war mit diesen Kopfh√∂rern sehr zufrieden, bis ich die Skullcandy Crusher ausprobiert habe. Die JBL E55BT sind von der Lautst√§rke besser als viele andere Modelle (Bose, Sennheiser usw.) Dazu war der Klang und das Volumen/ Bass sehr gut. Nun habe ich die Skullcandy ausprobiert, die ein noch hoheres Volumen aufweisen. Wem der Bass der Skullcandy zu doll ist, sollte auf die JBL zugreifen. Hier aber unbedingt das Modell E55BT, da die E65BTNC vom Klang her nicht die Leistung bringen.

These are decent wireless headphones, JBL is a great reliable brand and i don't really have many flaws to pick apart when it comes to these headphones. These are a good set if you like to relax and listen to music, wouldn't recommend as headphones to use at the gym or other activities such as that. The wireless feature doesn't go that far, so walking away from the device you're playing the music from cuts the music off, but works well when you're in the vicinity of the device. Can't complain at all, the sound is great and nice and loud. Well worth the price paid, overall i would recommend these headphones!

I am using them from January 2018. Bluetooth was randomly cutting off and not able to connect to my phone but it was working 90% of the time. Now, from a few days, I cannot connect via bluetooth at all... Using the jack is a no go for me... Anybody else with the same issue and any resolution or to search for something better?

I literally just got these out of the box to try it out, connected with my phone via bluetooth and put on a song on spotify. After like a couple of minutes the left headphone stopped working. I always thought JBL was a high quality product since I have the JBL Xtreme Bluetooth speaker. I returned it right away. Very disappointing.

I technically didn't use it because I had to check the comfort first (there is a possibility it's not comfortable). If you wear glasses and have piercings, I'd say it's a big 'no'. I do have a wider head too so my review is just about the comfort. If you have bigger ears it might not be great either.
You gotta give this model a try. Using for the gym stay on during intense cardio and lifting. Drowneds out the rest of they noise. Great buy super happy

I've been using this set for several weeks now and have had no problem. The sound is quite good and the cushions on the earpieces are comfortable. The charge holds for several hours and recharges quite fast. Overall I'm satisfied.

Vorweg kann ich f√ºr alle die sich die ganze Rezension nicht antun wollen schon mal sagen, dass ich von den JBL Tune500 Bluetooth Kopfh√∂rern begeistert bin. Sie passen wirklich gut, verbinden sich schnell und problemlos mit mehreren Ger√§ten und sehen dazu noch wirklich gut aus. *Versand und Verpackung* Die K√∂pfh√∂rer sind schneller angekommen als bei der Bestellung angegeben. Mittlerweile bin ich ja von den sehr kurzen Lieferzeiten von Amazon verw√∂hnt. Beim JBL Tune500 wurde jedoch eine Lieferzeit von mehr als einer Woche angegeben. Umso gl√ºcklicher war ich dann als sie schon nach 5 Tagen bei mir waren. Die Verpackung von Amazon war wie gewohnt gut. Der Kopfh√∂rer selbst kommt in einer "normalen" Verpackung. In diesem Preissegment darf man sich aber auch kein Apple-like packaging erwarten. Viel Plastik und rudiment√§res Zubeh√∂r. Mehr braucht man aber auch nicht. *Erster Eindruck* Die JBL Tune500 sind im ersten Augenblick nicht wirklich hochwertig. Sie sind sehr leicht und fast vollkommen aus Plastik. Wenn man jedoch genauer hinsieht merkt man, dass an den kritischen Stellen durchaus mit Metall gearbeitet wird. Besonders bei den Gelenken der Ohrmuscheln. Die Kn√∂pfe haben einen guten Druckpunkt und sind gut erreichbar. Der Kopfh√∂rer ist meiner Meinung nach sehr sch√∂n. Minimalistisch schon fast. Wer also mit seinen Kopfh√∂rern auffallen will sollte sich nach was anderem umsehen. *Benutzung und Klang* Die Verbindung mit dem Smartphone (iPhone 6s) funktioniert auf anhieb und ohne Probleme. Da kann man auch nicht mehr viel dazu sagen. Ist der Kopfh√∂rer mal gekoppelt muss man in nur noch einschalten und er verbindet sich automatisch mit dem Telefon. Easy peasy. Nun zum Klang. Ich hab mir nat√ºrlich kein Klangwunder erwartet, f√ºr den Preis. Ich war dann aber nicht schlecht √ºberrascht als ich den Kopfh√∂rer aufgesetzt hab. Er ist sehr laut. Auf voller Lautst√§rke kann man nur sehr kurze Zeit h√∂ren, wenn √ºberhaupt. Der Klang ist meiner Meinung nach gut bis sehr gut. Ich konnte es auch nicht glauben aber ich hab in dann mit meinen, schon in die Jahre gekommenen, Technics RP-DJ1210 DJ Kopfh√∂rern verglichen und war sehr √ºberrascht. Die JBL sind um Welten besser. Es fehlt ihnen vielleicht manchmal ein wenig an Mittelt√∂nen, aber bei gestreamter Musik aus dem Smartphone ist das wirklich nicht wichtig und man muss schon sehr genau hinh√∂ren. Ich bin begeistert vom Klang der kompakten Dinger. Ein Mikrofon ist nat√ºrlich auch eingebaut. Somit kann man nat√ºrlich auch Telefonate annehmen und √ºber die Kopfh√∂rer telefonieren. Mein Gegen√ºber hat mich ohne Probleme verstanden. Man klingt nat√ºrlich immer etwas weiter weg, aber das liegt wie bei allen Headsets daran, dass das Mikrofon eben neben dem Ohr ist und nicht in der N√§he des Mundes. Der Kopfh√∂rer verf√ºgt auch √ºber eine Taste mit dem man den pers√∂nlichen Assistenten aufwecken kann. In meinem Fall Siri. Ja, funktioniert nat√ºrlich auch ohne Probleme. *Fazit* Ich bin begeistert. F√ºr den Preis einen so guten Klang hinzubekommen ist schon eine Leistung. Das geringe Gewicht des Kopfh√∂rers ist meiner Meinung auch ein gro√üer Vorteil. Man sp√ºrt in nach einer Weile kaum noch am Kopf. Das einzige was man bem√§ngeln k√∂nnte ist die "nicht Premium" Verarbeitung. Punkteabzug gibts daf√ºr aber keinen, da der Preis auch alles andere als Premium ist. Kopfh√∂rer wei√üt so einige Designnachteile auf, weswegen ich ihn zur√ºckgeschickt habe. - Auff√§llig wie auch in anderen Rezensionen bemerkt: Rauschen, das besonders in leisen Stellen / bei H√∂rb√ºchern auff√§llt. - L√§sst sich nicht wirklich leise schalten - in Verbindung mit meinem S7 ist selbst auf der leisesten Stufe die Musik teilweise noch zu laut. - LAUTER SOUND BEIM EINSCHALTEN: Der typische JBL-Startup-Sound ert√∂nt bei jedem Einschalten und ist von der Lautst√§rke her angepasst an Schwerh√∂rige und solche, die es werden wollen. Partiamo col dire che non √® una cuffia per audiofili, forse anche a causa della tecnologia Bluetooth non pu√≤ vantare molti dettagli, e l'equalizzazione enfatizza notevolmente i bassi (io l'ho equalizzata togliendo 2 dB sulla banda dei 63 Hz ed 1 dB sulla banda dei 125 Hz). Non √® facile equalizzarla, perch√© diminuendo i bassi non restituisce maggiori dettagli come le cuffie pi√π dotate, piuttosto li va perdendo, quindi non modificate oltre i 125 Hz; e se il suono vi sembra troppo caldo/musicale sappiate che √® stata progettata cos√¨ (musicale = Beyerdynamic, dettagliata = Sennheiser). Detto questo la scena sonora √® sufficientemente ampia, la resa sonora √® come detto musicale (suono caldo), la separazione ed il posizionamento degli strumenti √® deludente e non rende bene una scena sonora troppo ricca, l'amplificazione √® eccellente (non dipende dalla sorgente!), non sono presenti rumori statici degni di nota, la batteria dura a lungo ed il segnale Bluetooth √® molto solido; √® anche piuttosto comoda ed esteticamente gradevole. I materiali sono appena discreti, chiaramente migliorando questi si poteva migliorare l'eccessiva risonanza sui bassi ma sarebbe triplicato il suo prezzo. Si ricarica in poco tempo. In questa fascia di prezzo non si pu√≤ pretendere di pi√π, anzi √® gi√† un mezzo miracolo, regge il confronto con cuffie ben pi√π costose. Sarebbe un bene se JBL ne sviluppasse una variante migliorata sulla fascia dei 70/80 euro, ma non so se la tecnologia Bluetooth sarebbe sufficientemente matura per consentirle un salto di qualit√†. Comoda ed in sostanza suona bene. Promossa.

Zudem sind die Kritiken zum kabellosen Kopfh√∂rer eher entt√§uschend und die kabelgebundenen zufriedener. Dennoch nutzen wir den zweiten Kopfh√∂rer, da nach cirka 1,5 Jahren nur noch eine Ohrmuschel funktionierte. Defekt war die Ohrmuschel, die wohl √ºber den Kopfb√ºgel mit dem Kabel verbunden ist. Das Kabel geht nur von einer Seite der Ohrmuschel ab. Ob dies durch das h√§ufige Auf-und Absetzen eines normalen Gebrauch und der damit verbundenen Einstellung des Koofh√∂rers verbunden sei ist fraglich. Der ersetzte Artikel ist nun seit 5 Monaten im Einsatz und funktioniert erwartungsgem√§√ü. - sicherer guter Klang - l√§sst Nebenger√§usche zu - guter Sitz, rutscht nicht - Kabel, da nur einseitig, verheddert sich nicht - Kabell√§nge ausreichend, jedoch nicht f√ºrs TV - Gr√∂√üeneinstellung ausreichend, geht auch bei einem Erwachsenen. Muschel dann jedoch zu klein - Ohrmuscheln f√ºr Kinderohren - kompakte Gr√∂√üe, leichtes Gewicht - Material ok, weiche Polster, kein Kunststoffgeruch, schadstofffrei? Zu empfehlen. Hoffe ich muss den Artikel nicht erneut kaufen/tauschen. Das Produkt erf√ºllt seinen Zweck und entspricht unseren Erwartungen.

Die Kopfh√∂rer machen so einen guten Eindruck, ich mache mir allerdings Sorgen um die Haltbarkeit in Kinderh√§nden. Die Ohrmuscheln sind in diverse Richtungen dreh- bzw kippbar, das Kabel ist zwar sch√∂n flach, dennoch kommt man immer gegen die Einstecktstelle vom Kabel. Preis-/Leistung ist sicher 1A.

JBL Reflect Flow Sport - True Wireless In-Ear For many years I have been a huge admirer of JBL products, in particular their speakers. From day one, when I first become hooked on music, JBL speakers were the speakers I aimed to strive for. Over the years this company have built up a huge reputation for quality products. With this in mind, I couldn't accept this product fast enough when it was offered to me by Amazon. I have had many blue-tooth rechargeable headphones/ear buds over the past few years. To be honest, only a small percentage of those have lived up to my expectations. When these arrived, I was pleased to find that the packaging at least, met my expectations. The headphones arrived very nicely presented within a tough storage box, a clear plastic cover displays the headphones within. I'm not normally one to become excited over packaging, but the excellent packaging was hopefully an indication of the quality of headphones that were held within. Although this was very nicely presented, it did take me quite a while to work out how to actually get into the packaging without destroying it. Once removed from the box I found not only the headphones which were neatly held in their charging case. I also found two further sets of ear buds, along with two sets of ear hooks, each offering a different size to try. Also included was a short USB charging cable. The charging case is not just a case for charging the headphones. It also contains a power-bank which stores power, thus charging the earbuds every time they are placed in the case. The case holds enough stored power to recharge the earbuds for up to 20 hours before you need to recharge the case. A row of LEDs illuminate showing how much power is remaining. Four lights mean that the case is fully charged. This is bigger than similar cases that I have owned, the same can be said of the headphones which are also quite large. The charging case is well made, it has a spring loaded cover that pops down tightly when closed. Inside the charging case you will find the headphones neatly slotted inside two specially shaped holders. Underneath are the copper contacts which are used to keep the headphones fully charged. Each ear piece displays a red light when it's in the case and is charging. Once removed, the light changes to a blue flashing light, this indicates they are in pairing mode. Once paired the blue light remains constant. After removing the headphones from the charging case, I found them to be much larger than other similar earbuds that I have tried. These are also a lot heavier than all that I've tried before. The build quality really is excellent, it's clear that the larger body of the headphones must hold a serious size speaker. With this in mind, I couldn't wait to give these a test run. After pairing with my phone, I slid each one into my ears. I am pleased to say, these were very comfortable to wear, they also seem to stay securely in place. These are the first ear-bud type headphones that have actually remained in my ears, this is without the need for me to keep poking them back in every few minutes or so. I don't know if it's the extra weight, the type of earbud silicone used, or just precise engineering? But, these stay put and are very comfortable to wear. What do they sound like? Well, in a nutshell.. these sound amazing! Most headphones I have tried recently seem to be bass heavy, I'm sure many love them, but I'm no fan of bass heavy headphones. I record and mix my own music, I like to hear my music as I intend it to sound. Bass heavy speakers interfere with that sound, changing the music from how I intend it to sound. Absolutely not so with these JBL Reflect Flow Sport headphones. The sound is crisp and clear, every note, high frequency or low frequency sound absolutely perfect. Nothing is lost, every detail is crystal clear. JBL certainly have lived up to all my expectations with these headphones, in fact they have far exceeded those expectations. Not only do these sound great, they also have some useful features. These are IPX7 rated, this means they will not be affected by water or sweat. Another feature is hands free operation, by using just one button, you can take calls or control your music. Bionic hearing will automatically adjust your music volume, keeping you aware of your surroundings whilst jogging, or chatting to friends whilst wearing the headphones. Lastly, the blue-tooth connection is rock solid, I have suffered no dropouts whatsoever, there is absolutely no interference, humming or crackles that I could detect. These really are top quality headphones with a top quality sound. If you are after bass heavy headphones, then you may wish to look elsewhere (or EQ the sound). These are geared up more for the audiophile who wants to listen to their music the way it is meant to be listened to. The sound is not coloured by any fancy gimmicks, just top quality speakers delivering top quality sound. Yes, the headphones may seem a little pricey at first glance, but I feel these are worth every penny of the asking price. In my opinion, quality costs money and these are pure quality. Highly Recommended! Contents: 1 X JBL Reflect sport headphones 3 X Various size ear tips 3 X Various size freebit 1 x Charging case 1 x Charging cable 1 x Quick start guide 1 x Warranty card 1 x Safety instructions If you have found my review at all helpful, I would very much appreciate if you could please click the 'Helpful' button below, thank you.

Bought these to replace some Bose Soundsport frees so this is comparing them against those and giving an honest review. Pros - Product comes well packaged and smartly presented - 3 different wings and tips included in the box (S. M. L) - Connected to phone via Bluetooth within a matter on seconds, no issues there. - Magnetic charging case has good capacity and the 10 hour battery life from the Buds alone is one of the best on the market. Total battery of around 30 hours playback is amazing. Been using for 1 week and not charged yet. - 3 different listening modes. Pass though, pass through with music and normal music. Differences are amazing. - Noise isolation is very good considering it's just isolating - Sound quality very impressive, perhaps lacking slightly in certain areas but no complaints compared to the Bose - Wings ensure a good fit and they don't feel loose in your ear, tested in the gym too and didn't fall out once - Buds comfortable, even for long periods of time. Cons - Microphone for calls is a little weak and could be improved UPDATE: Microphone quality has deteriorated over the last few weeks and if in noisy places, they are unusable for calls as the person on the other end can only hear background noise. Very disappointing

Ich hatte vorher sehr g√ºnstige in Ear Kopfh√∂rern zum testen f√ºrs t√§gliche Laufen im freien gekauft, weil ich nicht sicher war ob das was taugt. Bei den g√ºnstigen Kopfh√∂rern, √ºbrigens auch bei sehr hochwertigen arbeiten die Hersteller oft mit integrierten Soundverbesserungen (Software). Bei den g√ºnstigen um die schlechte Qualit√§t der Hardware (Lautsprecher) auszub√ºgeln und bei den sehr teueren um noch eine bessere Qualit√§t zu erzielen. Das h√∂rt man aber immer raus, da jedes Geh√∂r individuell ist. Bei diesen JBL hab ich das Gef√ºhl dass da wirklich alles so r√ºber kommt wie ich es abgemischt habe, kein √ºbertriebener Bass oder √ºbersteuerte H√∂hen.. wie bei einem linearen Verst√§rker. Das ist f√ºr mich Qualit√§t. Bisher bin ich sehr zufrieden. Habe sie erst vor 3 Tagen gekauft und werde sie am Sonntag wenn es drau√üen hell ist beim Sport testen... Feedback 2: Test beim Crosstraining Leider musste ich feststellen, dass die Kopfh√∂rer absolut untauglich f√ºr den Sport sind. Es treten mehrere Arten von St√∂rungen w√§ren des laufens auf: 1) Die Lautst√§rke der abgespielten Musik wird von den Au√üenger√§uchen beeinflusst, die Musik wird bei Wind oder √Ñnderung der Bodenbeschaffenheit leiser und dann dauert es eine Weile bis sie wieder lauter wird. 2) Ich h√∂re st√§ndig ein Knacken im rechten Ohrh√∂rer 3) Ich bekomme sobald ich am Laufen bin keine gescheiten B√§sse mehr zu h√∂ren. (alle Mitgelieferten gr√∂√üen der Ohr-Nupsis ausprobiert) 4) Wenn man das Pass thru (einmal links dr√ºcken, dass man die Umgebung h√∂rt) einmal eingeschaltet hatte wird der Ton nicht mehr so laut wie er vorher war. Ich kann mit diesen Teilen keinen Sport machen, ich bin st√§ndig abgelenkt und genervt. Ich werde sie zur√ºckschicken. 5)

Nach 3 Jahren mit meinen InEar JBL (bluetooth, mit Verbindungskabel) mussten neue H√∂rer her ‚Äì der Sitz wurde immer lockerer und das Kabel um den Nacken st√∂rte zuletzt massiv, vor Allem beim Sport. Rahmenbedingungen f√ºr Neukauf: - In Ear w/ Sport & Frisur - Komplett kabellose Bluetooth w/ st√∂render Kabelverbindung beim Sport) - Preisgrenze eigentlich unter 150 EUR - Guter Sound, nicht zu Hifi-m√§√üig aufgeblasen - Am besten Telefoniefunktion (verst√§ndlich f√ºr die anderen) und NC (hatte ich noch nie, fand den Gedanken aber bei den abendlichen Beschwerdeges√§ngen des kleinen Nachz√ºglers durchaus charmant‚Ä¶) Die Auswahl kam nach einer Runde googeln, Beschreibungen und Bewertungen durchlesen, und der naiven Vermutung, die Testgruppe intuitiv richtig gew√§hlt zu haben, zustande. Testkandidaten: - Sony WF-1000XM3 - Bose SoundSport Free - JBL Reflect Flow Sport - Sowie 3 weitere No-Name unter 60 EUR, teilweise mit Over-Ear B√ºgel oder dezidierte ‚ÄûSport‚Äú-H√∂rer - H√∂rer wie die Sennheiser Momentum oder Beats Overear fielen aufgrund Preis raus, H√∂rer wie von zB Jabra machten mir nicht den Eindruck, gut zu sitzen. Und letztlich wollte ich es auch nicht √ºberstrapazieren mit dem Test, was ich mE zwar schon mit der genannten Auswahl getan habe, dies aber nun in Form einer Rezension anderen Kaufinteressenten ggf ersparen m√∂chte. Fazit vorab: die Kandidaten in der no-name Liga konnten weder standalone noch im Vergleich (da erst recht nicht) √ºberzeugen. Optisch/ bewertungstechnisch mehr oder weniger vielversprechend, in puncto Bedienbarkeit, Haptik, Sitz und Klang teilweise einfach nur gelabeltes Billigzeug aus Fernost. Kein wirklicher Spass beim Tragen und H√∂ren. Value for money mag OK sein, aber wer ein ‚Äûbisschen mehr‚Äú will, muss einfach in einer anderen Preisklasse suchen. Hinzuf√ºgen sollte ich, dass ich musiktechnisch verw√∂hnt bin, und als Musiker auch B√ºhnen in Ear habe, die vierstellig kosten‚Ä¶ Noch was vorab: die Angaben der Hersteller sind m.E. irref√ºhrend, wenn man sich online anhand der Angaben z.B. einen sehr leichten H√∂rer aussucht. W√§hrend Sony unter Gewicht ‚Äû18g‚Äú angibt, wiegt ein H√∂rer auf der digitalen K√ºchenwage 9g. JBL gibt ‚Äû4,54g‚Äú an, ein H√∂rer kommt jedoch auch auf 9g. Die Bose wiegen lt. Hersteller 10g (habe diese jedoch nicht selbst nachgewogen). Bose: Von den Bose war ich pers√∂nlich entt√§uscht. Fand sie sehr gro√ü, etwas unhandlich und schwer (knapp 10g). Eigene App runterladen? Fummeln f√ºr Bluetooth Verbindung? Durchschnittlicher Klang? Ich hatte mir da weitaus mehr versprochen. Sony: Sehr guter Tragekomfort, erstaunlich bei dem Format und Gewicht (lt. Angabe 18g? kann das sein?), aber dennoch. Angenehmer Sitz. Wertige H√∂rer, ansprechendes Case mit guter Entnahme, kein Fummeln oder √§hnliches. Der Klang war eine Offenbarung. Sehr transparent, gut aufl√∂send, sehr breiter Sound, gut gef√§chert. Keine √ºbertriebenen B√§sse, einfach eine Freude die H√∂rer reinzustecken und Musik zu h√∂ren. OK ‚Äì wir reden √ºber das H√∂ren von Musik auf dem Handy bei einer der gro√üen Plattformen. Dass das alles qualitativ besser geht, ist klar. Aber im direkten Vergleich zu anderen In Ear m.E. herausragend. Die Funktionen ‚Äûambience‚Äú funktioniert sehr gut (dh man h√∂rt die Umgebung als w√§ren keine H√∂rer im Ohr). Ein gewisses Grundrauschen ist zu Hause bei Stille zu h√∂ren, aber mE vollkommen akzeptabel. Das Noise Cancelling funktioniert sehr gut ‚Äì vorausgeschickt, ich habe keine Erfahrung mit NC bei Overear und keine Vergleichswerte bei InEar. F√ºr mich aber dennoch √ºberraschend, und sehr effektiv. Gegen die eingangs genannten Ges√§nge hat das zwar bauartbedingt keine Chance, aber es schont definitiv die Trommelfelle, sollte es ben√∂tigt werden. Zwei Wermutstropfen: telefonieren kann man knicken. Beschwert sich das Ende der anderen Leitung gleich √ºber ‚Äûich h√∂r Dich ganz schlecht‚Äú. Ich denke, das wird aber bei allen kabellosen bluetooth H√∂rern so sein, die das Mikro im H√∂rer haben - insofern habe ich diese Erwartungshaltung (vern√ºnftig telefonieren mit In Ear) √ºber Bord geworfen. Zweiter Punkt: f√ºr Sport (Joggen bzw Hopsen auf der Matte etc) vollkommen ungeeignet. Leider. Nach drei Schritten Jogging wackelt der H√∂rer im Ohr. Da der Klang leider sehr sehr viel Freude macht, erw√§ge ich, reine Sport & reine Musik-H√∂rer f√ºr Reisen etc zuzulegen. Den letzteren Part √ºbernehmen dann ganz klar die Sony. JBL: Knapp 5g lt. Herstellerangabe. Im Heimtest klar den Sony unterlegen. Der Klang war mir etwas zu hifi gef√§rbt, etwas zu starke B√§sse. Jedoch: der Sitz ist bombenfest, gleichzeitig angenehm. Kein Ruckeln und Wackeln im Ohr beim Joggen. Und: die leichte Bass-Lastigkeit f√§llt nicht ins Gewicht, wenn man √§chzt und schwitzt und sich draussen bewegt. Insofern ist dieser Nachteil beim H√∂ren auf dem Sessel eher ein Vorteil beim Sport machen. Preis-Leistung f√ºr mich somit: klarer Kauf der JBL. Somit: jeder h√∂rt/ denkt unterschiedlich, ggf. werden aber oben einige Fragen beantwortet, die man sich vor dem Kauf stellt.

Excellent wireless earphones everything you need. Great sounding, great battery life and great fit. No chance of them falling out your ears and breakong. I am struggling to find any cons with these as theyse so good. I purchased the jbl 120s before these and sent them back due to terrible sound and fit in my ear. These cost a little more but are far better in every way. Edit: since I've posted this it's been a couple weeks and they have suddenly stopped charging. First the right one went then the left I have since returned them and got a refund. Since I liked them so much I have re ordered them in the hopes the ones I ordered where just defective. Hopefully this time they last longer than a couple of weeks.

Although I own a pair of Sony WH-1000XM3 Over-Ear headphones I decided I wanted a pair of earbuds for occasional use. I wasn‚Äôt willing to stretch to the Sony WF-1000XM3s and bought these JBL Reflect Flow Sport earbuds instead to use with my Moto G Android phone and Sony Walkman music player. This is my take on these JBL Reflect Flow earbuds - Pros - Well presented with a neat, robust charging case, alternative size ear fittings ‚Äì both wings and tips (medium are pre-fitted), large and small are in the box plus a USB micro charging lead. The mainly visual user guide is clear and will get you up and running. - You need to invest time in ensuring a good physical fit ‚Äì the better the seal between the earbud and your ear canal the better the sound is ‚Äì in particular, the bass. - Once fitted properly the earbuds stay in place during exercise. - I like the sound quality but depending on your taste it might need shaping with an equaliser, the bass is taut, mid-range has plenty of presence whilst the upper range is clear and not too harsh. Despite reports, I don‚Äôt think the bass is particularly prevalent, it‚Äôs dynamic, realistic and not too boomy. - Call handling is good with clear sound in both directions even with ambient noise. - Bluetooth (V5.0) connection is easy with LED indication, the range is decent and reception is largely noise-free and stable. - Controls soon become intuitive for managing calls and music playback (but see below). - The Ambient feature is handy in areas where you need awareness of external sounds. - Battery life is substantial ‚Äì playing time is around 10 hours and the internal battery in the case adds another 20 hours worth of charge. The buds have charge indicator LEDs plus the case has a four-segment indicator. - The earbuds are waterproof and sweatproof plus have support for voice assistants plus the right hand one can be used singly. - Overall build quality feels good including the case which is very well designed and made. Areas for development - No volume control ‚Äì control is via the host device. - Not supported by the JBL app. - Physical push button rather than touch controls. - Charging connection is Micro USB rather than USB C. - Ear tips can be a bit fiddly to change but you‚Äôll probably only do it once. - No firmware upgrade instructions that I can see. In summary, I‚Äôm very pleased with these JBL Reflect Flow earbuds, they offer good sound quality, comfort, resilience to water, ease of control and strong battery life at a reasonable price point.
Great product. Sound is amazing and it fits perfectly in the ear with no issue of falling off.

Bought these to replace a relatively cheap pair of ear buds which were failing. Have to say straight off that the sound quality is fantastic. However, I do find there to be several drawbacks to these head phones which I had not expected given the price point; (i) the ear buds often pair with my phone whilst docked in the charging case (case closed in my pocket) - pretty sure this isn't meant to happen and leads to some pretty comedic exchanges between me and a apparent phantom caller. (ii) when removed from the case they don't always (often) pair immediately with my phone (even though this is the only device I use them with). Quite often I am not able to pair buds and phone from the head phone controls (despite repeatedly watching online videos detailing the correct pairing instructions) and I'll have to return the head phones to the case to start the process again. First world issue I know, but it gets annoying. (iii) quite often the headphones do not charge whilst in the charging case. At first I put this down to my incompetence, but the truth is there is only one position the head phones can sit in the case and they should charge from that position. In my experience, that is not always the case, and on several occasions I have been left with inpoperable head phones due to lack of charge. This is probably why issue (i) happens too(?) (iv) Noise cancellation - I know these buds are meant to offer noise cancellation but in my extensive experience they simply don't. Short and tall of it is - I expected better from this brand and at this price point.

UPDATE: After 3 months of using them I started noticing a malfunction when charging them. It seems like the charging pins inside the case don't catch correctly the right earbud, hence it doesn't charge. I have to take it out and place it bad, jiggle it a bit, in order to find the right position. This is annoying and I've contacted help support. Let's see what solution they find. ORIGINAL REVIEW: They're a bit chunky/ intrusive in the ear. Not the smallest neither the lightest pair of earbuds. Though, these defects are balanced with the their higly secure fit. The in-ear bud and rubber wing secure the earbud in place, firmly, providing a bit of noice cancellation as well. The sound is really good. Even without active noise cancellation the earbud isolate yourself from the surroundings, immersing you in your fav tunes. Look really good when worn. Useful the "talk-through" functionality. The earbuds use a physical button to get instructions, they're not touch. Though the button is cushioned in a way that it doesn't annoy when pressed. Indeed, I'm quite happy with this physical button, since it doesn't catches random touches as instructions, as a touch earbud would, and it's comfortable to press. It has to be said that the earbuds lose connection at times. Generally between the first 5 minutes of connection, more likely when using a laptop. It has happened to me roughly once every 10 times, on average. I've been using the earbuds for 1 month. Very good battery life!! Happy with the purchase. Even if the product has some defects, its qualities are more relevant.

I've had these a few months now. Honestly, didn't find these to be worth how much I paid for them. Sound quality is good and noise cancelling great, and they initially charged very quickly and paired well. Just take them off charge, they sense this and pair up right away. Now, they are starting to have problems with connecting to the case charger. I will often take them out and one will be charged and the other flat. Even if I deliberately place them in firmly. As proof I've attached a vid I started filming when I was listening to music on my phone and one of them connected and started playing music while still 'charging' in the case.

Just getting the good stuff out of the way: excellent battery, fit is very nice and they feel light, solid clear sound (low bass as expected from small things). Superb BT range. The only and big issue is that the charging case has issues or the earbuds themselves i don't know. As has been commented by others here. The earbuds randomly reconnect to devices (i use them with PC) when in the case and then drain themselves over night even (mainly the right one). I assume they feel they got picked up or lost connection to the charging box or whatever. Right earbud struggles to start charging at all unless i plop it in at precisely the right angle, whatever that may be. Always have to wiggle it a lot. And then it still disconnects couple minutes later and thinks its done. nothing charges to full in 2 minutes as evidenced it dying multiple times now after short uses (30-60 min say). Charging works almost normally (sometimes even then have to wiggle the bud) when i take the rubber off of the right earbud and then put it in case. Annoying to use all in all and i guess i didnt win the lottery here. Cba to return it as the issue can be sidestepped sort of, just annoyed.
So easy to set up, very comfortable and secure fit, plenty of fit options too, didn't suit my wifes ears but were perfect for me. Highly recommend but fit is down to genes!

1. I'm hardly ever able to sync it with my phone - managed it twice, since then cannot be bothered, no matter how many tutorials I watch online, the thing just doesn't work. Bluetooth is also very unreliable. 2. Bad fit - tried it with all the tips, it still falls off from my ear, even walking, never mind trying to wear it while doing exercises (mainly why I bought it) 3. Sound quality is so low, compared to everything I used before. 4. Noise cancellation? What? Annoying to not get what I wanted and to put more waste into the world and also annoyed with me for not being able to send it back in time. (the package arrived while I was away) So the box is is sitting in the corner, not being used. Waste of money.

These earbuds feel secure in use, once the correct sizing is found. The sound is adequate for listening to whilst running or at the gym. I do find that my ears get a little sore after wearing for more than an hour

Ich finde die Tonqualit√§t der Ear-Buds ziemlich gut. Nicht zu viel Bass, nicht alles vermischt. Auch der Tragekomfort ist ganz gut. Nach 7 Std. im B√ºro beginnt man sie aber doch zu sp√ºren, wobei das nicht der allgemeine Use Case ist. Alles in allem wollte ich es einfach nicht wahr haben, dass dieses Produkt von der technischens Seite her aber eine Niete ist. Meine ersten Ear-Buds schalteten sich nach nur 1 Monat teilweise nicht mehr ein, trotz Reset etc. Ich dachte mir, das kann passieren. Umtausch √ºber Amazon (hat wie immer ausgezeichnet funktioniert). Das zweite Paar begann sich dann einfach immer selbst√§ndig zu entladen und insofern das Case innerhalb von zwei Tagen, ohne richtige Nutzung (vl 1-2 Std), fast vollst√§ndig zu entladen. Ich dachte mir nochmal, mir passt der Tragekomfort und auch die Tonqualit√§t. Insofern probierte ich es noch ein letztes Mal und was soll ich sagen...es ist JBL gelungen auf der einfachsten technischen Ebene zu Versagen. Tengo muchos auriculares. Bose, Apple, Sehnheiser, Senso, JBL... y quer√≠a estos por lo sencillo de su dise√±o, pero es justo su dise√±o y modo de uso lo que compromete su sonido. El nivel de su volumen es m√°s bien bajo y las frecuencias que aporta, esto es, su rendimiento en bajos-medios-agudos cambia de la noche al d√≠a seg√∫n te los aprietas y esta es la clave del problema. No son malos, pero no son buenos tampoco. Cualquier marca china a cambio de 50 o 60 euros puede ofrecerte un rendimiento similar. JBL es, o al menos era, una gran marca y por querer ofrecer un producto competidor de los AirPods de Apple pero a mitad de precio cae justo donde caen los de Apple: su no aislamiento. Al no aislarse tienes dos problemas: uno, la posici√≥n y postura de uso, que depender√° un poco en la forma de tus orejas permitir√° que te los acerques mejor o peor a tu pabell√≥n auditivo. La forma de mi oreja no ayuda demasiado. Si me los aprieto el sonido pega un cambio radical, mejora mucho y se aleja del sonido a lata que consigo si los dejo en su posici√≥n natural. Por otra parte al no ser aislantes el problema se incrementa, no porque dejes de o√≠r los ruidos de la calle, tr√°fico, gente hablando, sino porque al aislarse creas una c√°mara anecoica dentro de tus o√≠dos y que se forma desde el aislante y hacia dentro, con lo que concentras ese sonido mejor y m√°s pegado a ti. Al ser "abiertos" son c√≥modos, pero como haya mucho jaleo a tu alrededor su nivel puede ser incluso bajo para escuchar m√∫sica y voces. ir con ellos por la calle, haciendo ejercicio, o incluso estando en casa con las manos apret√°ndotelos es inviable, as√≠ que te los comes tal y como son. Les pasa otra cosa raruna: son algo perezosos a la hora de activarse y sincronizarse con mi iPhone. Los sacas de la caja, reducida y bien acabada pero algo inc√≥moda por tener una sujeci√≥n por im√°n algo excesiva, te los pones, y tardan... 10 o 12 segundos en sincronizarse. Si te llaman por tel√©fono y los sacas para responder, la situaci√≥n se puede convertir en confusa. Te los pones y suenan una serie de sonidos de activaci√≥n, luego de sincron√≠a, mientras que con la otra oreja, la izquierda, respondes al aparato, para que todo se quede en silencio un par de segundos, y empieces a escuchar por el oido derecho que es el "master" del duo. Se oye el tel√©fono por los dos, pero el izquierda es esclavo de derecho. Sin el derecho activado no haces nada. No son malos, pero tiene estos peros. No se si voy a devolverlos, sospecho que no, pero sin el aislante sus prestaciones se disipan mucho. Para andar por casa, escuchar podcast, bien, para escuchar m√∫sica peor, para ir con ellos por la calle... flojos. A mi entender, por sonido, comodidad, equilibrio calidad-precio, de largo los mejores que he usado son los Bose. El problema es que duran muy poco, est√°n fabricados con materiales y t√©cnicas que acaban fallando r√°pido.

Truth be told, i was skeptical before buying this. Tier 1 brand and lower price generally means compromises either on quality or sound. But, I'm glad that is not the case here. These earphones are Amazing!! 1. The Bass is present and it's very much noticeable. For workout boost, I like my earphones to have a good amount of bass and these babies pack a punch. 2. The sound is crisp and clear and surprisingly talking on call in a quiet room is also good enough. [Edit: Short calls can be made too while working out in gym without any problem on both ends]. 3. They fit very well in ears and doesn't fall off easily. The Twistlock as advertised is not at all a gimmick and definitely works as intended. Note: For better fit, I'll suggest you to watch official JBL video on Youtube. They've explained how to get these properly fit in ur ears. 4. Music playback is advertised as 8 hrs which should be good enough for a week's workout. Need to spend few days to actually test it. 5. It connects immediately without any issues and stays connected without any kind of drops. 6. I like the concept that there is no physical button and instead a touch panel is there. It's futuristic and fun to use. Note : it might take you time to understand but trust me it's not that hard. Once you get hang of it u'll love it. PS: It took me 35 seconds to figure out all controls and get mastery on it. :p 7. IPX7 rating means I don't need to worry about using it in rain. 8. Though not relevant, but the unboxing experience is also great. The way they have made the box feels premium right from the beginning. Honestly, it's really difficult to find a good pair of wireless earphones from a reputed brand in this budget, but these are definitely recommended and worth to give a shot. Also the touch controls gives u futuristic feel and though it can be difficult to operate in beginning but still worth it. The sound quality is great and packs a punch. Call quality is also good enough for a pair of wireless earphones. Final Verdict : Bang for the Buck!! EDIT: I found the wire troubling while turning my neck because even though smaller than other earphones it still a loose piece hanging freely which could be obstructing. Therfore I have ordered the upper model that is JBL Endurance Jump which has shorter and sturdier wire between the buds which i suppose would not create trouble.

I've always had problem of in-ear headphones just coming out of my ears. But those ones are perfect - I bought them especially to use them in the gym. They sound quality is not out of the world, but as good as it can be for the price. The touch controls are pretty sensitive but you just need to get used to them. I'm not sure how long exactly the battery lasts but I do not to have to charge them too often so it is good. Overall I am extremely happy with the purchase and would recommend these as a great workout headphones.

Its a good headphone for the price except couple of drawbacks Corns: - Not really comfortable to wear for long time. I initially thought I need to get used to it. But even after one week it stand the same. I have a Sennheiser PMX 686G, that fits correctly in my ear but not this one as its not fit in my right ear and loosens out after some time. - Its picking lot of background noice while calling and the caller on the other side can hardly hear when we are on public. These are the reason to return this item Pros: - Good Sound quality - Battery Backup is good - Good build quality

Unfortunately, as good as these headphones initially seemed, they didn't last long! After just ONE DAY of use, the right earphone had noticeably lower volume than the left. And yes, I did try all possible fittings. I even cleaned around the earphone just incase some sort of invisible wax was stuck on the speaker grille, no luck. Now, you may say that it was all in my head -- you know, placebo. Well, you're wrong! Wrong as hell! I switched earphones and the imbalance was noticeable from the right immediately. I then played around with the left and right channels, and after shifting the slider towards the right a tad, the music was centralised in my head. From the short experience I had with the headphones, the sound was neutral ‚Äî no real bias towards either spectrum of sound. The fit was... awful, to say the least. Yes, they will definitely stay-in-place, but the twist-lock method and general bulkiness of the product was a serious turn-off for me. Also, the tip enhancers weaken the bass. LAME! The touch controls are sensitive and could be annoying. But honestly, if I'm out running I don't want to mess around with a cable control. So, all-in-all, I think the touch controls are a benefit. Overall, I'm disappointed. This product has good sound for the price, but I can't possibly recommend a product that fails within a day.

The fit is what really sells this product, it's very comfortable and rock solid. The sound is good though I'm not an aficionado and don't have the best ear. The biggest weakness is the touch controls which are fiddly even when you get used to them, I still haven't been able to adjust the sound with them but as I generally have my phone with me that's not an issue for me. It's a good quality set of sports earbuds at a good price I'm very pleased with my purchase.

Bought these headphones a few months ago and it's probably the best pair I have ever had in all features. They're very confortable and don't come off even with heavy exercise and I found the sound to be well balanced. They're waterproof, which is essential for sports headphones, but the sound doesn't get too loud because of this. Might be good to not damage your audition though. The only negative IMO are the finnicky touch controls. All in all I would give them 4.5/5.

I bought for a week, it‚Äôs comfortable and don‚Äôt fall off easily. It‚Äôs a little pity that there‚Äôs a little annoying sound in background when I listen in silent space. But after all it is valuable(good price) and convenient .

It is worth its price. BUT YOU CANNOT USE IT WHEN YOU SWIM! It seems like that the wave of water can does your finger's job. I wear it onece when I swim, it cannot work normally and its sound qualidy declines because of water. But when I airdry it, it works well again. So its just a normal water-proof blueteeth airphone with an extent of negative sound-block effect. It won't break when you put it in water not deeper than 1 meater within 1 houur, but it can't work under water.

These are certainly comfortable and well put together but the sound is shocking. It's clear enough but it's extremely tinny with lower frequency sound more or less lost. I bought these to use on the bike and in that regards they'll do but this is not the "deep, powerful JBL sound" I was promised.

Great product. Sound quality is acceptable and just about loud enough. They are a compromised design but serve their purpose well. I'm not knocking the quality or anything, just that, as a design, they're never going to be exceptional. I previously had Sony in ear Bluetooth buds for use in the gym, but they were useless, and I sent them back after ten minutes use, despite being specifically marketed for use in the gym they simply fell out when you tried any type of exercise. These though are excellent in that respect, they stay perfectly in place even during a vigorous run on the treadmill. Just what I needed. As I said, sound quality is good, just not amazing, and the volume can sometimes be just a little low. Happy to recommend.

I've had a few bluetooth in-ear earphones in the past. What is great about these is that the two earplugs (while being somewhat larger) are really everything there is to these, so the cable can move around freely. This makes them very well suited for sports that involve a good deal of movement, say running. Unfortunately, I had high hopes that a JBL product (which is significantly pricier than its competitors) would be more durable. That's not the case. I've been very careful with these, but after just a few months (and usage only during workouts), the left earplug has ceased to work. Not good enough!
Well its a nice peace...worth a go ...the only problem is ..they lasted 3 months ...disapointing ...left piece stoped working

*** Update 2 *** Here's an excerpt from an email from JBL... " This email is regarding the pairing issue you are experiencing between the Alexa app and your Live 220BT. We would like to inform you that we are currently looking into this problem and working on improving this experience. Please keep an eye out for future updates to the JBL Headphones app. There is unfortunately no solution for this issue at this time. We do apologise for any inconvenience caused " ***update 1*** I take back what I said about the battery. Less than one week in and its down to only holding a charge for five hours out of the ten it claims. ***ORIGINAL REVIEW***** This is NOT a review of a free product. I'll just get that bit out there now. I'm not passing comments on anyone elses review, I'm simply saying I used my hard earned cash to buy these. Some people like myself pref to know that little nugget. So to start with the good. They are comfy, feel well constructed and the braided wire is a nice touch. The battery also seems to stand up to their claims. Another plus is the call quality, something Sony seemed to have forgotten about in recent years. The not so good is the music sound quality. It's ok. Just. But for ¬£70 I want more than Ok with slightly decent bass. I've an eclectic taste and like my music on random. I can tell you now if you have anything remotely rocky you will want to skip these. The associated android app for these is shockingly bad, which is a shame as you need it to configure which assistant you want to use. That won't bother everyone but it is one of the reason I went for these. My hope was to be able to use Alexa as we are an echo household. After more than a few resets and restarts of both phone and earphones I've given up. To sum up these so not deliver what's on the box. Look elsewhere on Amazon, you'll find better for less. I now have to decide if I can bring myself to suck up the fact I've paid ¬£70 for a something worth ¬£40 at best.

I bought these to replace standard Apple headphones when on walks. I am listening to podcasts, speech and music. There is a fair bit of mechanical noise when walking as the cables can rub against clothing but you get used to this. I have a much bigger concern around sound quality - they are very bright sounding but the bass is very poor. You can adjust this using the app which makes a bit of a difference but is still much worse than standard Apple headphones. The app also struggles to connect to my phone, and continually wants to connect a second time, meaning I cant check the battery status without fiddling around disconnecting and reconnecting Bluetooth. I also using the headset for calls, and it cant seem to keep its Bluetooth connection for more that 2 minutes. It then tries to connect again, and it becomes very frustrating. I though ¬£40 odd quid would get something OK, especially with the JBL badge on, but maybe I need to spend a bit more. Will be returning.

First of all I do not like in ear headphones that being said these are wonderful. I can not feel them in my ear and are really comfortable. Sound quality is amazing nice bass without it being over powering. The assistant button is great for Google (and Alexa) if you get a notification push the button and it reads it out to you! Press and hold the assistant button and you use it like Google home. The other great thing is the talk through mode. Press the correct button and it will turn on a small speaker to which you can hear the outside world without taking the buds out! IE if someone is talking to you just push the button to hear them, just like an hearing aid. The last mode is ambient mode which lets you hear the outside world plus hear you music/podcast at the same time so you are well aware of your surroundings. I got these for ¬£40 and worth every penny!

Much better than expected. Sounds quality is fantastic. Alexa is great, but I was disappointed the Alexa setup does not work with Spotify. Ambient mode is great when walking in the street. Great cost effective alternative to the echo buds.

Got it in a deal for 1899/- and here are my thoughts. 1. Connectivity and Range: Very Good. It powers on fast and pair easily & quickly, and I can even walk between rooms without any loss in signal or quality. 2. Sound: Decidedly average. It is definitely boosted, so if you do like punchy bass and are not particular about texture or accuracy, no problems. Sound better than almost anything that comes packaged with a smartphone. Distortion creeps in at 65%+ volume 3. Usability: They fit snugly, and isolate just enough so you can hear your music well but also know what's going on in traffic around you. 4. Calls: Under normal circumstances these are fine. Person on the other side had some problem hearing me when I've used these while cycling. 5. Battery: Good. I use them for about 2-3 hours a day and charge them every 3 days. They charge in a couple of hours and are good to go. Battery lasts for around 5-6hours on an average. Overall: Easy to recommend if you're only looking for an upgrade to generic earbuds and want to try wireless. Battery life and connectivity are great so no issues there. However, if you're primarily looking for a good listening experience, I'd say pass on this one.

*Edited* After having this for a couple of months, here is the final veredict: * battery does not last long. * terrible for the gym. It is awkward. doesn't stay in place. Controls are heavy, cord is far too long, keeps pulling it down. I wouldn't buy this again nor would recommend. You pay for what you get I think. Good: Excellent sound, extremely light, easy to carry, looks good and good price. Bad: No button to skip the songs (have to long press the volume key instead). Not great for weight lifting (still sticking to my headphones for that) and it feels a tad flimsy but i'm hopping it will last. Conclusion: Good as a spare bluetooth earphones. I will probably use this one for travelling for now one instead of my bulky headphones. Sound quality is trully excellent. You can't get any better for this price.

Size and lookwise MIFA A1 is better then JBL Go.

Excellent product from JBL, I really loved it. Connectivity:- 9/10 Pros-Bluetooth version: 4.1 make the connectivity very easy&fast. Cons-There is no password facility so it may bother to someone who love to personalize the things. For me it's not an issue. Portability:-10/10 It‚Äôs a portable speaker made for music lovers. It's very compact and light weight so very easy to port it anywhere and enjoy the music. Sound Quality:- The sound quality of the speaker is excellent. It's base is able to full a 10*10 room completely. It's only 3.1W RMS but sound output is fantastic. Color Options:- 10/10 I ordered Teal color. It's also available in different colors which are following: Teal, Yellow, Pink , Blue, Grey, Orange ,Red ,Black. Battery is slightly weaker than other Famous Brands like Bose, Amazon Basic. But it's not a big difference. It gives Up-to 5 hours battery backup with full volume . It's sufficient. Pricing :-9/10 Price is genuine as per the quality. Other Brands are also in the same price range so price is competitive. Finally I can say it's a must buy product.

Superb voice. With good copy of songs, you get feeling of 'fullness' of voice in the room of 10 X 10 feet size. Gran bocina en un gran tama√±o, les explicar√© por qu√©: Primero la marca, JBL es de las marcas m√°s reconocidas en cuanto a sonido, esta bocina en particular es de gama media, entonces podemos esperar una calidad de sonido limpia, sin distorsiones a volumen alto, con bajos no tan fuertes pero presentes, medios adecuados y bien integrados, en general un gran sonido para gente que no es tan exigente, en cuanto a potencia por el tama√±o que tiene (7x8cm) podemos esperar que llene de sonido a una habitaci√≥n peque√±a promedio sin dificultades, esto se vuelve una ventaja si queremos llevar nuestra m√∫sica a un d√≠a de campo, a una peque√±a reuni√≥n o simplemente escuchar m√∫sica en la habitaci√≥n. Ahora hablando un poco de la conectividad y cuestiones t√©cnicas, cuenta con bluetooth con una distancia aproximada de unos 3 mts (sin barreras) sin cortes, esto a tener en cuenta que en otras marcas se pierden conexiones aproximadamente a los 2 mts, tambi√©n cuenta con conexi√≥n de auxiliar de 3,0 mm (la universal) para disfrutar m√∫sica con dispositivos que no cuenten con caracter√≠sticas bluetooth, algo a tomar en cuenta y que me parece un punto fuerte, es que cuenta con la opci√≥n de responder llamadas directamente desde la bocina con un bot√≥n ubicado en la parte superior, por lo que si tienes el tel√©fono a unos 2 mts de distancia y recibes una llamada, basta con presionar el bot√≥n y hablar directamente en la bocina, en cuesti√≥n de la bater√≠a, esta dura aproximadamente 5 hrs que obviamente depender√° del uso que se le de, a qu√© volumen se escuche y as√≠, tambi√©n cuenta con un espacio para colocarle alg√∫n cord√≥n y pueda traerse en la bicicleta o simplemente mejorar el agarre del altavoz. Por √∫ltimo hablar del manejo, bastante intuitivo con botones en la parte superior encender/apagar, sincronizaci√≥n bluetooth, control de volumen y de contestar llamada, cuenta con un led de color azul que nos indica cuando est√° conectado a alg√∫n dispositivo y que cambia de color a rojo cuando debe cargarse. En resumen, la mejor bocina que encontrar√°n por este precio, si bien hay opciones dentro de la misma gama que sobresalen m√°s que esta, son m√°s costosas (por ejemplo la Sony SRS X1), sin embargo, esta bocina explota lo mejor de su tama√±o y sonido, recomendada ampliamente a gente que viaja mucho o que simplemente necesita un altavoz que sea compacto, funcional, de calidad y que suene bien.

Truth be told I'm not much of a techie person. So if you're looking for a really professional review using big terms and are looking for an opinion about this product in a techie point of view don't read this review...... However what review I'll give you is my honest opinion on the product in a normal persons point of view... The sound quality of the speaker is excellent,maybe not as good as a Bose or something like that,but if you're looking for a speaker for purposes varying from chilling with friends during a sleepover or a simple dance rehearsal,then I highly recommend this. It is also very very light weight,and easy to carry around ( I for one have carried this in my pocket) The colour (I ordered the hot pink one) is bright and great if you want to make a statement. So if you leave it somewhere and forget about it, someone will probably call you up,and will also probably return it back to you because the pink is attractive and they've noticed it.(or they might not,you know, they might just take it for themselves...who knows??) So if you're looking for a speaker to begin with...then go for it,buy it..you'll love it.

It's been 1.5 years since the time I purchased this beauty, and without a doubt it's one of the best purchases I've ever made. - Good Sound Quality - Good Bluetooth Range - Reasonable battery backup (5-6 hours with non-stop music) - Portability beast (I've literally carried it in my pocket on numerous treks - hence the title) - Rough & tough (It has fallen quite a number of times, and never sustained any damages..still works like a charm) - High Return on Investment The sound isn't as powerful as some of its big brothers, but it delivers a lot more than what you'd expect from it. I bought this speaker as I wanted to blow my room up with thundering music but was low on budget. I had used other speakers cheaper than this but wasn't satisfied one-bit, until I used this. There is no other speaker that is this good in this price range. Close your eyes and go for it.

Ich denke Funktionalit√§t und Tonqualit√§t stehen nicht unbedingt in Kontrast, beim Charge 4 scheint der Fokus aber vor allem auf Ersterem zu liegen. Immerhin kann man 2x Charge 4 Ger√§te, falls vorhanden, im Stereomodus miteinander verbinden. Aber wer stellt sich schon zwei davon in denselben Raum? Durch die Wasserdichtheit kann man ihn schnell zum Duschen mit ins Bad nehmen, zum Training oder zum Grillen drau√üen und auf Partys. Durch die zu erwartende weite Verbreitung wie beim Charge 4 macht das Connect+ Feature dann auch praktisch Sinn. Ein zwei Andere werden wohl auch ein Ger√§t mit Connect+ haben und schon steht in jedem Raum eine Box und es wird Laut. TIPP: Beim Ein- und ausschalten ert√∂nt ansonsten ein relativ lautes Ger√§usch um zu zeigen dass der Charge 4 einsatzbereit ist, was man aber auch anhand der beleuchteten Tasten sehen kann. Eher dumpfer Klang -Preis sehr Hoch Im Ranking der drei Boxen w√ºrde ich Anker Platz 1, Bose Platz 2 und die JBL aufgrund des enormen Preises gegen√ºber den beiden auf Platz 3 sehen. Nun etwas ausf√ºhrlicher: Verarbeitung: Die Verarbeitung ist Top. Das Material f√ºhlt sich sehr hochwertig an und da der Lautsprecher relativ schwer ist, f√ºhlt sich es im allgemeinen sehr wertig an. Sehr Positiv gegen√ºber den anderen beiden Lautsprechern ist die Klappe der Ladeanschl√ºsse gel√∂st.
